originalText: tch_vuk
Start Element
vuk
Get outta here, $(#bro/sis)!
Psycho is on the loose!

::The man you just approached seems casual and relaxed. His suit is covered with dirt, blood and some green slime, and you notice what appear to be large strands of hair stuck in it. He extends his right hand to shake yours but withdraws it in the last moment after noticing that their cleanliness matches that of his suit.::

Hey, $(#bro/sis). Is there something I can help you with?
Good work there $(#bro/sis). Psycho is one big... psycho! ::He laughs.:: Once it gets mad it gets so scary it could even frighten Tchort! Um...forget I said that.
Hey, good to see you $(context.player.Name). How can I help you?
context.loc_tch_invasionStarted
context.npc_tch_vuk_met
Tchort is evolution, brother. I am $(context.player.Name) and I would like to ask you a few questions.
Evolution is Tchort. I am Vuk. Well, since I'm on a break I suppose I could answer a few questions. Go ahead, $(#bro/sis). Ask.
Not at all; I'm taking a short break now so a chat is fine by me. I am Vuk, by the way, pleasure to meet you. What was it you wished to ask, $(#bro/sis)?
::[Biology]:: You have plenty of interesting creatures here. Do you have any exotic samples I could use in my research?
I am interested in a trade.
I talked to Principal Investigator Rista and he told me we can trade.
What do you do around here?
I wanted to ask you if you know anything about some odd creatures that are plaguing Foundry at the moment.
How come these creatures you have here aren't aggressive?
Since you work with animals - do you have any spare organs or other parts that I can acquire?
What can you tell me about this pacification procedure performed on animals?
Can you tell me who's in charge here?
Exotic? Like... from the Deep Caverns?
Let me just get the squishies, $(#bro/sis).
If he says it's okay - it's okay! Let me just change my gloves, $(#bro/sis), and I'll show you what I've got.

Well, $(#bro/sis), I'm one of the biologists working in this department. As you can see from my general appearance this is a very, very dirty job. To give an example, this green stuff I'm covered with actually came from one of the coil spiders we have in the holding pens. I was in its enclosure and then it approached and suddenly regurgitated *this* stuff all over me. I have yet to figure out why.
What are the creatures in questions?

It's all due to the pacification procedures we have performed on them. Only the dangerous ones like burrowers and coil spiders. They usually don't tolerate human presence and show it, um, by trying to tear you to pieces.

I am in charge of that, but you'll get nothing for free if that's what you're implying. On the other hand, I could sell you some but... um... You know what, go talk to Principal Investigator Rista and see if you can get his permission. If he says "yes" then come back to me. I'll wait here.

As you probably suspect already, we have found a way to make the creatures non-aggressive to other species. Unfortunately, I can't tell you the details on how we do it. Well, at least I don't know if I'm allowed to so I better not... Seek Rista, our PI; he's in charge of the project and can tell you more.
Ah. AH! You seek Principal Investigator Rista, right? His office is over there. ::He points at the double doors.:: That's his office - enter at your own risk. Tchort guide you.
Ditto, $(#bro/sis).
Tchort guide you.
::Barter.::
::[Biology]:: Female spiders have a tendency to regurgitate fluids to starved individuals; maybe it's seeing you as one of her own kin.
They look like larvae, with weird heads shaped like small drills.
I already talked to him and he told me it's okay.
::He shrugs.:: Sorry, $(#bro/sis).
Okay... See ya.
::He shrugs.:: Sure. All in the name of Investigation, right?

Listen, I am-- ::He pauses for a second.:: You know what, $(#bro/sis)... you might have a good point there. Magnificent Tchort, yes! The pacification procedure we performed on these creatures could have caused them to view us ways we haven't really expected. Hmmm, perhaps in her mind I'm one of her young or a distressed unit.
This is serious stuff I'm talking about, $(#bro/sis). You have to get used to these sort of things if you wish to work in the department.
That is odd, as you say. Can't help you, I'm afraid. I have no experience with anything resembling that description.
Yeah?
Tchort guide you and good luck.

::He simply chuckles but gives you no further explanation.::

Anything else?
Tchort guide you too.
I'll be back soon.
It is the benefit of the outside view, $(#bro/sis). We who work on something can sometimes get so focused on it that it narrows our vision. We fail to see other things. Good work!
I... not without PI Rista's permission I can't. You should go to him, and if he says yes - then I'd be good to help you.
::He chuckles but says nothing otherwise.::
He already said no.
::Vuk simply shrugs.::
His office is over there. ::He points at the double doors.:: That's his office - enter at your own risk. Tchort guide you.
Yes, $(#bro/sis)?
